results.title: Fentanyl-Induced Chest Wall Rigidity as a Cause of Acute Respiratory Failure in the Intensive Care Unit
results.text_hl: She was known to have @DISEASE_Asthma @DISEASE_MESH:D001249 @@@bronchial asthma@@@ treated with @CHEMICAL_Fluticasone_Salmeterol_Drug_Combination @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068297 @@@seretide@@@ 25/250 two puffs ON + PO monteleukast 10 mg ON, @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ treated with PO @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ 50 mg BD, @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes mellitus@@@ controlled with PO @CHEMICAL_Linagliptin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069476 @@@linagliptin@@@ 5 mg OM and a previous right @<m>DISEASE_Thalamic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013786 @@@thalamic@@@ @DISEASE_Cerebral_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D002544 @@@ischemic stroke@@@ 5 years ago for which she was on PO @CHEMICAL_Clopidogrel @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077144 @@@clopidogrel@@@ 75 mg OM and PO @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Ming PW, Singh DL. Fentanyl-Induced Chest Wall Rigidity as a Cause of Acute Respiratory Failure in the Intensive Care Unit J Med Cases. 2019 Aug;10(8):249-252. PMID: 34434315
